meanings.sent1: The brave knight set out to exterminate the dragon terrorizing the village.
meanings.sent2: The pest control company was called to exterminate the termite infestation in the house.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to exterminate all evil from the city, starting with the supervillains.
meanings.sent4: The powerful storm seemed to exterminate everything in its path, leaving only destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The virus spread rapidly, threatening to exterminate the entire population if not contained.

meanings.definition: To get rid of by killing
meanings.sent1: The farmer had to exterminate the pests eating his crops to protect his harvest.
meanings.sent2: The government issued orders to exterminate the dangerous wild animals that were attacking livestock.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to exterminate all doubts by finding the true culprit of the crime.
meanings.sent4: The brave soldier knew he had to exterminate the enemy to protect his country.
meanings.sent5: The hunter aimed carefully to exterminate the target with a single shot.

meanings.sent1: The new technology promised to exterminate all errors in the system, making it flawless.
meanings.sent2: The strict diet plan aimed to exterminate unhealthy habits and promote better health.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to exterminate the rabbit from the hat, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat threatened to exterminate all life in the desert, creating a barren wasteland.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers were strong enough to exterminate any threat to the city.
